text.textblock: Special Visual Flight Rules; Denver, CO; Rule
Special Visual Flight Rules (SVFR); Denver, CO

summary.textblock: This action amends appendix D, part 91, of the Federal Aviation Regulations to accurately reflect the name of the new Denver, Colorado, airport. The new Denver International Airport, scheduled to open in March 1994, will replace the Denver Stapleton Airport. Appendix D, part 91, lists locations, including Denver, Colorado, where special operating restrictions apply. This action will not affect any procedures or practices currently in place, but it is necessary to correctly state the name of the new Denver airport.

further.textblock: Ms. Ellen Crum, Air Traffic Rules Branch (ATP-230), Airspace-Rules and Aeronautical Information Division, 800 Independence Avenue SW., Washington, DC 20591, telephone (202) 267-8783.

supplem.textblock: Appendix D, part 91, lists airports/locations where special operating restrictions apply. Section 1 lists the locations at which the requirements of §91.215(b)(2) apply. (Aircraft operating within 30 nautical miles of an airport, listed in Section 1, from the surface upward to 10,000 feet mean sea level must be equipped with a Mode C transponder.) Section 3 lists the locations where fixed-wing special visual flight rule (SVFR) operations are prohibited. Both sections list the name of the Denver, Colorado, airport as ``Denver Stapleton Airport.''

On March 9, 1994, the new Denver International Airport will open, replacing the Denver Stapleton Airport. This amendment replaces the word ``Stapleton'' with the word ``International'' in sections 1 and 3 of appendix D, part 91.
List of Subjects in 14 CFR Part 91
Aircraft, Airmen, Airports, Air traffic control, Aviation safety.
In consideration of the foregoing, the Federal Aviation Administration amends part 91 of the Federal Aviation Regulations (FAR) (14 CFR part 91) as follows:
1. The authority citation for part 91 continues to read as follows:

49 U.S.C. app. 1301(7), 1303, 1344, 1348, 1352 through 1355, 1401, 1421 through 1431, 1471, 1472, 1502, 1510, 1522, and 2121 through 2125; articles 12, 29, 31, and 32(a) of the Convention on International Civil Aviation (61 Stat. 1180); 42 U.S.C. 4321
2. Sections 1 and 3 of appendix D are amended at the ``Denver, CO'' entry by replacing the word ``Stapleton'' with the word ``International.''
Issued in Washington, DC, on January 12, 1994.

signjob.textblock: Assistant Manager, Airspace-Rules and Aeronautical Information Division.
